results.title: All is well on the border front
results.creator_credit: Akram Zaatari, Future Television and Lebanon Theater
results.brief_description: A tribute to Godard’s seminal “Ici et Ailleurs” (Here and Elsewhere), video artist Akram Zaatari’s documentary, like its predecessor, critically explores issues of representation within the occupied zone of South Lebanon. Interviews with Lebanese prisoners in Israel illustrate aspects of life under occupation with convincing poignancy. In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Akram Zaatari, Future Television and Lebanon Theater

results.title: Pandemonium
results.creator_credit: Haydn Keenan, KFM Pandemonium, Smart Street Films and Tra La La Films
results.brief_description: Haydn Keenan’s “Pandemonium” is a schlock horror movie that aims to displease by entertaining themes of Neo-Nazism, torture, vampirism, incest, sado-masochism, mental illness, necrophilia and bestiality. In the opening sequence Kales Leadingham has escaped from a lunatic asylum. Arriving at a bus stop be relays his travails (in flashback) to a woman seated there. One day at Bondi Beach, Sydney, a woman ‘Dingo Girl’ arrives in search of answers to her past (cue unremitting shots of Dingo Girl’s large breasts, a la Russ Meyer). Shortly after Dingo Girl and Kale enter a warehouse where a bizarre array of subversive types reside. Inhabitants engage in ritualistic Neo-Nazi ceremonies that result in sado-masochistic sex. Amid other activities, a foetus is placed in a blender, Little Adolph has his penis cut off, cloning experiments go awry - whilst numerous musical interludes interrupt the action. Deliberately provocative, and seeking to shock, this film revels in its low-budget amateurism and artlessness. Aesthetically it shares much in common with “Flesh for Frankenstein” and “Rocky Horror Picture Show” but has no hope of achieving the cult status of these enduring films, principally because its relentlessly over-the-top mood and delivery rob it of any impact as comedy or as horror. The unremitting black humour, shoddy sets, trashy costuming, bad taste themes and poor acting, make “Pandemonium” a curio of Australian filmmaking. Cast includes David Argue, Amanda Dole, Esben Storm, Ian Nimmo, Gary Foley, Haydn Keenan, Ignatius Jones, Lex Marinos.

results.title: The Circle = Dayereh = Il Cerchio [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jafar Panahi, Jafar Panahi Film Productions, Lumière & Co. and Mikado Film Srl (Rome)
results.brief_description: From Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi (The White balloon), comes The Circle” a tale of female oppression in modern day Iran. “The Circle opens in a hospital maternity ward where a woman has just given birth. Her mother is horrified by the catastrophic outcome - its a girl. She had been assured (via ultrasound) that it would be a boy and laments the fact that a divorce will ensue and her daughter will be shamed. This opening sequence reflects the status of women in Iran, as unwanted, second-class citizens without rights or a voice in society. “The Circle” tells the stories of several women in a city over the course of one day and night. Simple acts of buying a bus ticket or smoking a cigarette in public are denied to women and are punishable by law. The women of the film, in constant danger of imprisonment and harassment, are shunned by their families and seek refuge with each other. Panahi adopts a documentary style for this feature film, as street noise fills the soundtrack and the camera follows the characters around, almost hounding them. “The Circle” was banned in Iran due to its controversial subject matter. In Farsi with English subtitles. (Awards: Winner of the Golden Lion, Best Film at the 2000 Venice Film Festival)

results.title: Operation Blue Whale
results.brief_description: On May 5th 1992 a dead nineteen metre Blue whale was washed ashore on the South Coast of Victoria. This video documents the challenges faced by the Museum of Victoria in retrieving the carcass, and the preparation of the skeleton for permanent exhibition at the Museum. Photography, music and narration by Dr David Smith. Rights held by Dr David Smith.

results.title: Sir Jack Brabham: The complete history of a motor racing legend
results.creator_credit: Neville Hay and Hay Fisher Productions
results.brief_description: Brabham - one of the great names in motor racing history. A great driver who not only became a household name worldwide during the 1950’s and 60’s for his driving exploits, but who also created a racing team that was still winning in the 1980’s. This story of Sir Jack Brabham, told exclusively in his own words and by close associates including Stirling Moss, Roy Salvadori and and John Cooper. Extensive archival material captures the feel of some glorious motor racing while tracing every step of a truly brilliant career.

results.title: Steam across the mountains: the story of the Zig Zag Railway
results.creator_credit: Nick A'Hern, ABC Video and Nick A'Hern Productions
results.brief_description: The Zig Zag Railway is regarded as an engineering marvel and a mecca to students of engineering the world over. This fascinating video follows the Zig Zag’s colourful history from its early days in the great commercial steam era, to its closure in 1910 and through to its restoration as a tourist railway in 1975. This program uses the Zig Zag Railway as a working model to bring to life the romance adventure and style of the Great Australian Steam Era. Highlights include: complete stereo soundtrack, breathtaking footage shot entirely on 16mm film and loads of steam trains to see and hear!
results.title_for_label: Steam across the mountains: the story of the Zig Zag Railway
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nick A’Hern, ABC Video and Nick A’Hern Productions

results.title: Steam alive in Victoria: a tribute to steam
results.brief_description: The history of Victoria’s steam trains runs parallel to the history of the state itself. As the railway tracks made their way into the countryside, the state began to develop. Steam locomotives puffing their way into country towns were the life blood of the state, bringing in supplies and visitors and taking away produce and goods. Today the steam locomotives have been replaced. Many were left to rust and decay but a number of them have been restored by dedicated groups of volunteers, determined to preserve this exciting part of our heritage. Steam trains are alive again in Victoria and this magnificent videotape is a tribute to those groups who have kept the locomotives on the tracks to give pleasure to those who love steam travel. You can enjoy the thrill of the journey, the heat of the firebox and the shrill of the whistle as you watch “Steam Alive in Victoria”.

results.title: A Day in the life of a child: introducing environmental action
results.creator_credit: Stephen Weingarth, Tim Cramer and Educational and Documentary Video Productions
results.brief_description: Filmed in Australia, this program combines acting, animation and real life environmental situations in homes, schools and communities. Demonstrates how young people can think and act in an environmentally friendly manner and have fun as well.

results.title: Classic cars in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jeff Watson and Jeff Watson Productions
results.brief_description: Featured in “My Car” on “The World Tonight” with Clive Robertson. In an age when all cars look the same, this video profiles the cars we would all like to own, or did own. Some of the cars features are the Austin Healy “Bug-Eye” Sprite, Austin 7, Ford Mustang, Jaguar SS, Mercedes-Benz 300SL “Gullwing”, Morris Minor, Volkswagen 1946, plus classic cars from the Repco Mountain Rally.

results.title: Work: a window on Australian society
results.creator_credit: Greg Shepherd, Mervyn Dober, Appleseed Productions and Focus Audio-Visual Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australia at work”.
A four part series examining Australians’ attitudes to work and to changes in the Australian workplace. This first episode introduces some key concepts in any discussion of work: labour, division of labour, industry, and industrial relations. Through interviews with a wide cross-section of people the video examines what is meant by work and the work ethic, and examines how people define themselves through work.
